verses.verse: ( Jesus’ Authority Challenged) ( ( 470 21:23-27 ; 480 11:27-33 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ἐγένετο <WG1096> egeneto - ἐν <WG1722> en - μιᾷ <WG1520> mia One τῶν <WG3588> tōn - ἡμερῶν <WG2250> hēmerōn day διδάσκοντος <WG1321> didaskontos was teaching αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou [as Jesus] τὸν <WG3588> ton the λαὸν <WG2992> laon people ἐν <WG1722> en in τῷ <WG3588> tō the ἱερῷ <WG2411> hierō temple [courts] ( Literally the temple) καὶ <WG2532> kai and εὐαγγελιζομένου <WG2097> euangelizomenou proclaiming the gospel , ἐπέστησαν <WG2186> epestēsan came up [to Him] . οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἀρχιερεῖς <WG749> archiereis chief priests καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - γραμματεῖς <WG1122> grammateis scribes , σὺν <WG4862> syn together with τοῖς <WG3588> tois the πρεσβυτέροις <WG4245> presbyterois elders ,

καὶ <WG2532> kai - εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan - λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes they said πρὸς <WG4314> pros - αὐτόν <WG846> auton - , Εἰπὸν <WG2036> Eipon “ Tell ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin us , ” ἐν <WG1722> en “ by ποίᾳ <WG4169> poia what ἐξουσίᾳ <WG1849> exousia authority ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta these things , ποιεῖς <WG4160> poieis are You doing ἢ <WG2228> ē [and] τίς <WG5101> tis who ἐστιν <WG1510> estin - ὁ <WG3588> ho - δούς <WG1325> dous gave σοι <WG4771> soi You τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἐξουσίαν <WG1849> exousian authority ? ” ταύτην <WG3778> tautēn this

Ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> Apokritheis - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [Jesus] replied πρὸς <WG4314> pros - αὐτούς <WG846> autous - . Ἐρωτήσω <WG2065> Erōtēsō “ I will also ask ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas you κἀγὼ <WG2504> kagō vvv λόγον <WG3056> logon a question , ” καὶ <WG2532> kai - εἴπατέ <WG2036> eipate “ Tell μοι <WG1473> moi Me :

Τὸ <WG3588> To - βάπτισμα <WG908> baptisma baptism — Ἰωάννου <WG2491> Iōannou John’s ἐξ <WG1537> ex from οὐρανοῦ <WG3772> ouranou heaven , ἦν <WG1510> ēn was it ἢ <WG2228> ē or ἐξ <WG1537> ex from ἀνθρώπων <WG444> anthrōpōn men ? ”

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de - συνελογίσαντο <WG4817> synelogisanto They deliberated πρὸς <WG4314> pros among ἑαυτοὺς <WG1438> heautous themselves λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes [and] said , ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - Ἐὰν <WG1437> Ean “ If εἴπωμεν <WG2036> eipōmen we say , Ἐξ <WG1537> Ex ‘ From οὐρανοῦ <WG3772> ouranou heaven , ’ ἐρεῖ <WG2046> erei He will ask , Διὰ <WG1223> Dia ‘ Why τί <WG5101> ti . . . οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἐπιστεύσατε <WG4100> episteusate did you not believe αὐτῷ <WG846> autō him ? ’

ἐὰν <WG1437> ean if δὲ <WG1161> de But εἴπωμεν <WG2036> eipōmen we say , Ἐξ <WG1537> Ex ‘ From ἀνθρώπων <WG444> anthrōpōn men , ’ ὁ <WG3588> ho the λαὸς <WG2992> laos people ἅπας <WG537> hapas all καταλιθάσει <WG2642> katalithasei will stone ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us , πεπεισμένος <WG3982> pepeismenos convinced [that] γάρ <WG1063> gar for ἐστιν <WG1510> estin they are Ἰωάννην <WG2491> Iōannēn John προφήτην <WG4396> prophētēn a prophet . ” εἶναι <WG1510> einai was
Καὶ <WG2532> Kai So ἀπεκρίθησαν <WG611> apekrithēsan they answered [that] μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv εἰδέναι <WG1492> eidenai they did not know πόθεν <WG4159> pothen where [it was] from .

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai And ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen replied αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois . . . , Οὐδὲ <WG3761> Oude “ Neither ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō will I λέγω <WG3004> legō tell ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you ἐν <WG1722> en by ποίᾳ <WG4169> poia what ἐξουσίᾳ <WG1849> exousia authority ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta these things . ” ποιῶ <WG4160> poiō I am doing

Ἤρξατο <WG756> Ērxato He proceeded ( The Parable of the Wicked Tenants) δὲ <WG1161> de Then πρὸς <WG4314> pros - τὸν <WG3588> ton the λαὸν <WG2992> laon people λέγειν <WG3004> legein to tell τὴν <WG3588> tēn - παραβολὴν <WG3850> parabolēn parable : ταύτην <WG3778> tautēn this Ἄνθρωπος <WG444> Anthrōpos man [τις] <WG5100> tis “ A ἐφύτευσεν <WG5452> ephyteusen planted ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna a vineyard , καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐξέδετο <WG1554> exedeto rented αὐτὸν <WG846> auton it out γεωργοῖς <WG1092> geōrgois to [some] tenants , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπεδήμησεν <WG589> apedēmēsen went away χρόνους <WG5550> chronous time . ἱκανούς <WG2425> hikanous for a long

καὶ <WG2532> kai - καιρῷ <WG2540> kairō At harvest time , ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen he sent πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γεωργοὺς <WG1092> geōrgous tenants δοῦλον <WG1401> doulon a servant ἵνα <WG2443> hina to ἀπὸ <WG575> apo [his share] τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the καρποῦ <WG2590> karpou fruit τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard . δώσουσιν <WG1325> dōsousin collect αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . οἱ <WG3588> hoi the δὲ <WG1161> de But γεωργοὶ <WG1092> geōrgoi tenants ἐξαπέστειλαν <WG1821> exapesteilan [and] sent him away αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . δείραντες <WG1194> deirantes beat [the servant] κενόν <WG2756> kenon empty-handed .

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [So] προσέθετο <WG4369> prosetheto vvv ἕτερον <WG2087> heteron another πέμψαι <WG3992> pempsai he sent δοῦλον <WG1401> doulon servant , οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de but κἀκεῖνον <WG2548> kakeinon . . . , δείραντες <WG1194> deirantes they beat [him] καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀτιμάσαντες <WG818> atimasantes treated him shamefully ἐξαπέστειλαν <WG1821> exapesteilan sending [him] away κενόν <WG2756> kenon empty-handed .

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then προσέθετο <WG4369> prosetheto vvv τρίτον <WG5154> triton a third , πέμψαι <WG3992> pempsai he sent οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de but καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . τοῦτον <WG3778> touton him τραυματίσαντες <WG5135> traumatisantes they wounded ἐξέβαλον <WG1544> exebalon [and] threw [him] out .

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen asked δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho the κύριος <WG2962> kyrios owner τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard . Τί <WG5101> Ti ‘ What ποιήσω <WG4160> poiēsō shall I do ? ’ πέμψω <WG3992> pempsō ‘ I will send τὸν <WG3588> ton - υἱόν <WG5207> huion son . μου <WG1473> mou my τὸν <WG3588> ton - ἀγαπητόν <WG27> agapēton beloved ἴσως <WG2481> isōs Perhaps τοῦτον <WG3778> touton him . ’ ἐντραπήσονται <WG1788> entrapēsontai they will respect

Ἰδόντες <WG3708> Idontes saw δὲ <WG1161> de But when αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [the son] , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the γεωργοὶ <WG1092> geōrgoi tenants διελογίζοντο <WG1260> dielogizonto they discussed it πρὸς <WG4314> pros among ἀλλήλους <WG240> allēlous themselves λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes [and] said , Οὗτός <WG3778> Houtos ‘ This ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is ὁ <WG3588> ho the κληρονόμος <WG2818> klēronomos heir . ἀποκτείνωμεν <WG615> apokteinōmen Let us kill αὐτόν <WG846> auton him , ἵνα <WG2443> hina [and] ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn ours . ’ γένηται <WG1096> genētai will be ἡ <WG3588> hē the κληρονομία <WG2817> klēronomia inheritance

καὶ <WG2532> kai So ἐκβαλόντες <WG1544> ekbalontes they threw αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ἔξω <WG1854> exō out of τοῦ <WG3588> tou the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard ἀπέκτειναν <WG615> apekteinan [and] killed [him] . Τί <WG5101> Ti What οὖν <WG3767> oun then ποιήσει <WG4160> poiēsei do αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois to them ? ὁ <WG3588> ho will the κύριος <WG2962> kyrios owner τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἀμπελῶνος <WG290> ampelōnos vineyard

ἐλεύσεται <WG2064> eleusetai He will come καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπολέσει <WG622> apolesei kill τοὺς <WG3588> tous - γεωργοὺς <WG1092> geōrgous tenants , τούτους <WG3778> toutous those καὶ <WG2532> kai and δώσει <WG1325> dōsei will give τὸν <WG3588> ton the ἀμπελῶνα <WG290> ampelōna vineyard ἄλλοις <WG243> allois to others . ” Ἀκούσαντες <WG191> Akousantes [when the people] heard [this] , δὲ <WG1161> de And εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan they said , Μὴ <WG3361> Mē “ vvv γένοιτο <WG1096> genoito May such a thing never happen ! ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἐμβλέψας <WG1689> emblepsas [Jesus] looked directly at αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said , Τί <WG5101> Ti what οὖν <WG3767> oun “ Then ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is τὸ <WG3588> to that which γεγραμμένον <WG1125> gegrammenon is written : τοῦτο <WG3778> touto the meaning of Λίθον <WG3037> Lithon ‘ [The] stone ὃν <WG3739> hon - ἀπεδοκίμασαν <WG593> apedokimasan rejected οἱ <WG3588> hoi the οἰκοδομοῦντες <WG3618> oikodomountes builders Οὗτος <WG3778> Houtos - ἐγενήθη <WG1096> egenēthē has become εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . κεφαλὴν <WG2776> kephalēn [the] cornerstone γωνίας <WG1137> gōnias . . . ’ ? ( )

Πᾶς <WG3956> Pas Everyone ὁ <WG3588> ho - πεσὼν <WG4098> pesōn who falls ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ on ἐκεῖνον <WG1565> ekeinon this τὸν <WG3588> ton - λίθον <WG3037> lithon stone συνθλασθήσεται <WG4917> synthlasthēsetai will be broken to pieces , ἐφ’ <WG1909> eph’ vvv ὃν <WG3739> hon he on whom δ’ <WG1161> d’ but ἂν <WG302> an . . . πέσῃ <WG4098> pesē it falls λικμήσει <WG3039> likmēsei will be crushed αὐτόν <WG846> auton . . . . ”

( Paying Taxes to Caesar) ( ( 470 22:15-22 ; 480 12:13-17 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [When] ἐζήτησαν <WG2212> ezētēsan they sought οἱ <WG3588> hoi the γραμματεῖς <WG1122> grammateis scribes καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - ἀρχιερεῖς <WG749> archiereis chief priests ἐπιβαλεῖν <WG1911> epibalein to arrest ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ . . . αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him τὰς <WG3588> tas . . . χεῖρας <WG5495> cheiras . . . ἐν <WG1722> en vvv αὐτῇ <WG846> autē that very τῇ <WG3588> tē - ὥρᾳ <WG5610> hōra hour . καὶ <WG2532> kai But ἐφοβήθησαν <WG5399> ephobēthēsan they were afraid τὸν <WG3588> ton of the λαόν <WG2992> laon people . ἔγνωσαν <WG1097> egnōsan realized γὰρ <WG1063> gar - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that πρὸς <WG4314> pros against αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them , εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [Jesus] had spoken τὴν <WG3588> tēn - παραβολὴν <WG3850> parabolēn parable ταύτην <WG3778> tautēn this

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai So παρατηρήσαντες <WG3906> paratērēsantes they watched [Him] closely ἀπέστειλαν <WG649> apesteilan [and] sent ἐνκαθέτους <WG1455> enkathetous spies ὑποκρινομένους <WG5271> hypokrinomenous who pretended ἑαυτοὺς <WG1438> heautous - δικαίους <WG1342> dikaious sincere . εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be ἵνα <WG2443> hina They were hoping ἐπιλάβωνται <WG1949> epilabōntai to catch [Him] αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou in His λόγου <WG3056> logou words ὥστε <WG5620> hōste in order παραδοῦναι <WG3860> paradounai to hand Him over αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . τῇ <WG3588> tē to the ἀρχῇ <WG746> archē rule καὶ <WG2532> kai and τῇ <WG3588> tē - ἐξουσίᾳ <WG1849> exousia authority τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the ἡγεμόνος <WG2232> hēgemonos governor .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐπηρώτησαν <WG1905> epērōtēsan they inquired αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes . . . , Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , ” οἴδαμεν <WG1492> oidamen “ we know ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ὀρθῶς <WG3723> orthōs correctly . λέγεις <WG3004> legeis You speak καὶ <WG2532> kai and διδάσκεις <WG1321> didaskeis teach καὶ <WG2532> kai - οὐ <WG3756> ou You show no partiality λαμβάνεις <WG2983> lambaneis . . . πρόσωπον <WG4383> prosōpon . . . , ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ but ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ in accordance with ἀληθείας <WG225> alētheias the truth . τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδὸν <WG3598> hodon way τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God διδάσκεις <WG1321> didaskeis teach
ἔξεστιν <WG1832> exestin Is it lawful ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas for us Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar φόρον <WG5411> phoron taxes δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to pay ἢ <WG2228> ē or οὔ <WG3756> ou not ? ”

Κατανοήσας <WG2657> Katanoēsas [Jesus] saw through δὲ <WG1161> de But αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their τὴν <WG3588> tēn - πανουργίαν <WG3834> panourgian duplicity εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτούς <WG846> autous them ,

Δείξατέ <WG1166> Deixate “ Show μοι <WG1473> moi Me δηνάριον <WG1220> dēnarion a denarius . ( A denarius was customarily a day’s wage for a laborer; see .) τίνος <WG5101> tinos Whose ἔχει <WG2192> echei are on it ? ” εἰκόνα <WG1504> eikona image καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπιγραφήν <WG1923> epigraphēn inscription Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπαν <WG2036> eipan they answered . Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros “ Caesar’s , ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [Jesus] told πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὐτούς <WG846> autous them , Τοίνυν <WG5106> Toinyn So ἀπόδοτε <WG591> apodote “ Give τὰ <WG3588> ta what [is] Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros Caesar’s , Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὰ <WG3588> ta what [is] τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou God’s . ” τῷ <WG3588> tō - Θεῷ <WG2316> Theō to God

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai And οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἴσχυσαν <WG2480> ischysan they were unable ἐπιλαβέσθαι <WG1949> epilabesthai to trap Him in αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His ῥήματος <WG4487> rhēmatos words ἐναντίον <WG1726> enantion before τοῦ <WG3588> tou the λαοῦ <WG2992> laou people ; καὶ <WG2532> kai and θαυμάσαντες <WG2296> thaumasantes amazed ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi at τῇ <WG3588> tē - ἀποκρίσει <WG612> apokrisei answer , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His ἐσίγησαν <WG4601> esigēsan they fell silent .

Προσελθόντες <WG4334> Proselthontes came ( The Sadducees and the Resurrection) δέ <WG1161> de Then τινες <WG5100> tines some τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the Σαδδουκαίων <WG4523> Saddoukaiōn Sadducees , οἱ <WG3588> hoi who ἀντιλέγοντες <WG483> antilegontes say there is no ἀνάστασιν <WG386> anastasin resurrection , μὴ <WG3361> mē . . . εἶναι <WG1510> einai . . . ἐπηρώτησαν <WG1905> epērōtēsan to question αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him .

λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes they said , Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , ” Μωϋσῆς <WG3475> Mōusēs “ Moses ἔγραψεν <WG1125> egrapsen wrote ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin for us ἐάν <WG1437> ean that if τινος <WG5100> tinos a man’s ἀδελφὸς <WG80> adelphos brother ἀποθάνῃ <WG599> apothanē dies ἔχων <WG2192> echōn [and] leaves γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika a wife καὶ <WG2532> kai but οὗτος <WG3778> houtos vvv ἄτεκνος <WG815> ateknos no children , ᾖ <WG1510> ē vvv ἵνα <WG2443> hina - λάβῃ <WG2983> labē is to marry ὁ <WG3588> ho vvv ἀδελφὸς <WG80> adelphos [the man] αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou vvv τὴν <WG3588> tēn [his brother’s] γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika [widow] καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐξαναστήσῃ <WG1817> exanastēsē raise up σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma offspring τῷ <WG3588> tō for ἀδελφῷ <WG80> adelphō [him] . ( ) αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou vvv

ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven οὖν <WG3767> oun Now ἀδελφοὶ <WG80> adelphoi brothers . ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan there were καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὁ <WG3588> ho The πρῶτος <WG4413> prōtos first [one] λαβὼν <WG2983> labōn married γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika a wife , ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen [but] died ἄτεκνος <WG815> ateknos childless .
καὶ <WG2532> kai Then ὁ <WG3588> ho the δεύτερος <WG1208> deuteros second ( BYZ and TR include married the widow, and he also died,)

καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho the τρίτος <WG5154> tritos third ἔλαβεν <WG2983> elaben married αὐτήν <WG846> autēn [the widow] , ὡσαύτως <WG5615> hōsautōs in the same way δὲ <WG1161> de and καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . οἱ <WG3588> hoi [all] ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven οὐ <WG3756> ou no κατέλιπον <WG2641> katelipon leaving τέκνα <WG5043> tekna children . καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἀπέθανον <WG599> apethanon died ,
ὕστερον <WG5305> hysteron last of all , καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἡ <WG3588> hē the γυνὴ <WG1135> gynē woman ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen died .
